pageContext.description: Bust length portrait of the Saxon elector, facing left against a blue background, wearing a fur-trimmed gown and a beret.
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 20.6 × 14.5 × 0.4 cm
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]
pageContext.inscription:
- top left: 'IOHANN DER ERSTE, CHVR / FVRST VUND HERZOG / ZV SACHSEN'
- beneath the portrait: 'NACH MEINES LIEBEN BRUDEREN ENDT / BLIB AUF MIR DAS GANTZ REGIMENT. / DEN BAUREN KRIG HALFF ICH DURCH GOTT / DEMPFEN ERRET DEVTSLAND AVS NOT. / GROS DRAVEN BITTER HASS VND NEVD / ICH VM GOTTTES WORTS WILLENLEID. / FREII BEKANDT ICHS AVS HERTZEN GRUND / VND PERSONLICH SELBST ICH DA STVND. / VORN KEISER CARLN VND GANTZEN REICH, VON FVRSTEN WAR GESCHEN NIE DES GLEICH. / FERDINAND ZVM ROMISCHEN KONIG MACHT / DER GVLDEN BVLLN HALBN SEIN WHAL ANFACHT. / WIE WOL DER KEISER HASSET MICH / WIEDRVM DOCH LIEBET HERTZLICH.'
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]

metadata.title: Johann I the Steadfast, Elector of Saxony

pageContext.provenance:
- 1838 listed in the catalogue of the Graimbergsche Collection (Leger 20)
- 1878 acquired together with the collection by the city of Heidelberg
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
- stable condition 
Support: 
a slight convex warp is visible across the grain; there are small triangular indentations (c. 2mm in length) at the centre of the top and bottom edge, possibly from a previous framing (?); heraldic right c. 4 cm split, slightly open on the reverse but not on the front 
Ground/Paint  layers:
- network of cracks, coarse in the background and fine in the dark areas; numerous old  losses and scratches particularly in the background, all have been retouched without being filled, the retouching has discoloured slightly 
Coating:
- probably contains wax, slightly yellowed and in part cloudy, uneven gloss matt and sunk in the areas of retouching 
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]

tests.text:
- a single hardwood plank, almost radial cut, vertical alignment of the grain, sanded on both sides, width of the bevel: left/right to 2 cm, top/bottom to 3.4 cm 
- Verso: brown coating, date of application unknown, c. 2 mm unpainted edges, suggesting the panel was at somes stage fixed in a grooved frame

- a light coloured, very thin ground (probably glue/chalk mix) was applied to the front of the panel
- extends to the edges of the panel, a distinctive barb is not visible, it may have been fixed in a temporary frame when the ground was applied
- visible in normal light beneath the paint layers: a dark pigmented fluid medium, possibly applied with a brush, sketchily describing the main contours and essential details

- pigments ground in an oil-based medium, very thin application with brushes of varying thickness, applied in some areas in more than one layer, also some scumbling with opaque paint
- paint in the background appears to have been dabbed on
-  the figure was initially laid in with dead colouring; brush strokes clearly visible in the fur collar, the paint was modulated with light and dark admixtures of the base tones, employing a wet-in-wet technique, fine lines and hatching strokes (black/dark brown/white) were used to create volume 
- the contour along the shoulder and around the hat was reinforced with blue paint 
- there are parallel incised lines c. 2mm from the edge of the panel 
- an original coating could not be found during this technical examintation

- the prignial frame no longer exists; the panel was fixed in a grooved frame for an undetermined period of time 
[Kurpfälzisches Museum Heidelberg, revised 2020]

titles.title: Johann I the Steadfast, Elector of Saxony
